medical_history.chief_complaint: Adrenal insufficiency with associated symptoms after vaccination.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient presented at 3 months of age with acute crises including vomiting, dehydration, hypotension, and electrolyte imbalances. Symptoms appeared after a first dose of hexavalent vaccination.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Congenital lipoid adrenal hyperplasia due to StAR mutations.
medical_history.family_history: Consanguineous family history; three siblings of the father and two siblings of the mother died at the age of 1-2 years.
medical_history.social_history: The infant is the only child of a large consanguineous family.
